paragraphs.title: RDF By Modularity Clustering example
paragraphs.text:
import scala.collection.mutable
import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession
import org.apache.log4j.{ Level, Logger }
import net.sansa_stack.ml.spark.clustering.RDFByModularityClustering

val graphFile = "hdfs://namenode:8020/data/Clustering_sampledata.nt"
val outputFile = "hdfs://namenode:8020/data/clustering.out"
val numIterations = 1

// check if output exists and remove if necessary
import org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration
import java.net.URI
val conf = new Configuration()
val fs = FileSystem.get(new URI("hdfs://namenode:8020"), conf)
val resultsPath = new org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path("/data/clustering.out")
if(fs.exists(resultsPath))
  fs.delete(resultsPath, true)

RDFByModularityClustering(sc, numIterations, graphFile, outputFile)

msg.data:
import scala.collection.mutable

import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession

import org.apache.log4j.{Level, Logger}

import net.sansa_stack.ml.spark.clustering.RDFByModularityClustering

graphFile: String = hdfs://namenode:8020/data/Clustering_sampledata.nt

outputFile: String = hdfs://namenode:8020/data/clustering.out

numIterations: Int = 1

import org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem

import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration

import java.net.URI

conf: org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration = Configuration: core-default.xml, core-site.xml, mapred-default.xml, mapred-site.xml, yarn-default.xml, yarn-site.xml, hdfs-default.xml, hdfs-site.xml

fs: org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem = DFS[DFSClient[clientName=DFSClient_NONMAPREDUCE_2059290783_30, ugi=root (auth:SIMPLE)]]

resultsPath: org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path = /data/clustering.out

res13: AnyVal = true
The number of nodes in the knowledge graph is 8 and the number of edges is 13.
The first ten edges of the graph look like the following: 
(<http://twitter/user0>,<http://twitter/user1>)
(<http://twitter/user0>,<http://twitter/user2>)
(<http://twitter/user0>,<http://twitter/user3>)
(<http://twitter/user1>,<http://twitter/user2>)
(<http://twitter/user1>,<http://twitter/user3>)
(<http://twitter/user1>,<http://twitter/user6>)
(<http://twitter/user2>,<http://twitter/user3>)
(<http://twitter/user3>,<http://twitter/user4>)
(<http://twitter/user4>,<http://twitter/user5>)
(<http://twitter/user5>,<http://twitter/user6>)
Starting iteration

1
The computed clusters are:
Cluster1  contains:
<http://twitter/user1>, 

Cluster2  contains:
<http://twitter/user3>, 

Cluster3  contains:
<http://twitter/user7>, 

Cluster4  contains:
<http://twitter/user5>, 

Cluster5  contains:
<http://twitter/user4>, 

Cluster6  contains:
<http://twitter/user6>, 

Cluster7  contains:
<http://twitter/user0>, <http://twitter/user2>,
